past.c

00001 /* past.c -- triggering after numbers get "past" a certain point ------- */
00002 
00003 #include "ext.h"
00004 
00005 typedef struct past
00006 {
00007     t_object p_ob;
00008     t_atom p_vector[8];
00009     short p_size;
00010     short p_set;
00011     void *p_out;
00012 } t_past;
00013 
00014 void past_int(t_past *x, long n);
00015 void past_float(t_past *x, double f);
00016 void past_list(t_past *x, t_symbol *s, short ac, t_atom *av);
00017 void past_clear(t_past *x);
00018 void past_set(t_past *x, t_symbol *s, short ac, t_atom *av);
00019 void past_assist(t_past *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s);
00020 void *past_new(t_symbol *s, short ac, t_atom *av);
00021 void past_assign(t_past *x, short ac, t_atom *av);
00022 short past_compare(t_past *x, t_atom *a, long index);
00023 
00024 void *past_class;
00025 
00026 int main()
00027 {
00028     setup((t_messlist **)&past_class, (method)past_new,0L, (short)sizeof(t_past), 0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00029     addint((method)past_int);
00030     addfloat((method)past_float);
00031     addmess((method)past_list,  "list",     A_GIMME,0);
00032     addmess((method)past_clear, "clear",    0);
00033     addmess((method)past_assist,"assist",   A_CANT,0);
00034     addmess((method)past_set,   "set",      A_GIMME,0);
00035     finder_addclass("Control","past");
00036 
00037     return 0;
00038 }
00039 
00040 void past_int(t_past *x, long n)
00041 {
00042     t_atom a;
00043     
00044     a.a_type = A_LONG;
00045     a.a_w.w_long = n;
00046     if (x->p_size==1) {
00047         if (past_compare(x,&a,0) > 0) {
00048             if (!x->p_set) {
00049                 x->p_set = 1;
00050                 outlet_bang(x->p_out);
00051             }
00052         } else {
00053             x->p_set = 0;
00054         }
00055     } else {
00056         if (past_compare(x,&a,0) < 0)
00057             x->p_set = 0;
00058     }
00059 }
00060 
00061 void past_float(t_past *x, double f)
00062 {
00063     t_atom a;
00064     
00065     a.a_type = A_FLOAT;
00066     a.a_w.w_float = f;
00067     if (x->p_size==1) {
00068         if (past_compare(x,&a,0) > 0) {
00069             if (!x->p_set) {
00070                 x->p_set = 1;
00071                 outlet_bang(x->p_out);
00072             }
00073         } else {
00074             x->p_set = 0;
00075         }
00076     } else {
00077         if (past_compare(x,&a,0) < 0)
00078             x->p_set = 0;
00079     }
00080 }
00081 
00082 void past_list(t_past *x, t_symbol *s, short ac, t_atom *av)
00083 {
00084     short i;
00085     short canfail,result;
00086     
00087     canfail = false;
00088     if (ac <= x->p_size) {
00089         result = past_compare(x,av,0);
00090         if (result >= 0) {
00091             if (result == 0)
00092                 canfail = true;
00093             for (i=1; i < ac; i++) {
00094                 result = past_compare(x,av+i,i);
00095                 if (result < 0) {
00096                     if (canfail) {
00097                         x->p_set = 0;
00098                         return; /* move this inside bracket 7/8/92 */
00099                     }
00100                 }
00101                 if (canfail && result == 0)
00102                     canfail = 1;
00103                 else
00104                     canfail = 0;
00105             }
00106             if (!x->p_set) {
00107                 x->p_set = 1;
00108                 outlet_bang(x->p_out);
00109             }   
00110         } else {
00111             x->p_set = 0;
00112         }
00113     }
00114 }
00115 
00116 void past_clear(t_past *x)
00117 {
00118     x->p_set = 0;
00119 }
00120 
00121 void past_set(t_past *x, t_symbol *s, short ac, t_atom *av)
00122 {
00123     if (ac)
00124         past_assign(x,ac,av);
00125 }
00126 
00127 void past_assist(t_past *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s)
00128 {
00129     if (m == ASSIST_INLET)
00130         sprintf(s,"Input to be Synchronized");
00131     else 
00132         sprintf(s,"bang When Numbers Rise Above Specified Value");
00133 }
00134 
00135 void *past_new(t_symbol *s, short ac, t_atom *av)
00136 {
00137     t_past *x;
00138     
00139     x = (t_past *)newobject(past_class);
00140     x->p_out = bangout((t_object *)x);
00141     past_assign(x,ac,av);
00142     x->p_set = 0;
00143     return x;
00144 }           
00145 
00146 void past_assign(t_past *x, short ac, t_atom *av)
00147 {
00148     short i;
00149     
00150     if (ac > 8)
00151         ac = 8;
00152     for (i = 0; i < ac; i++,av++)
00153         x->p_vector[i] = *av;
00154     x->p_size = ac;
00155 }
00156 
00157 short past_compare(t_past *x, t_atom *a, long index)
00158 {
00159     t_atom *b;
00160     float temp1;
00161     
00162     b = x->p_vector + index;
00163     if (a->a_type == A_LONG) {
00164         if (b->a_type == A_LONG) {
00165             if (a->a_w.w_long > b->a_w.w_long)
00166                 return 1;
00167             else if (a->a_w.w_long == b->a_w.w_long)
00168                 return 0;
00169             else
00170                 return -1;
00171         } else if (b->a_type == A_FLOAT) {
00172             temp1 = (float)a->a_w.w_long;
00173             if (temp1 > b->a_w.w_float)
00174                 return 1;
00175             else if (temp1 == b->a_w.w_float)
00176                 return 0;
00177             else
00178                 return -1;
00179         } else {
00180             if (a->a_w.w_long > 0)
00181                 return 1;
00182             else if (a->a_w.w_long == 0)
00183                 return 0;
00184             else
00185                 return -1;
00186         }
00187     } else if (a->a_type == A_FLOAT) {
00188         if (b->a_type == A_LONG) {
00189             temp1 = (float)b->a_w.w_long;
00190             if (a->a_w.w_float > temp1)
00191                 return 1;
00192             else if (a->a_w.w_float == temp1)
00193                 return 0;
00194             else
00195                 return -1;
00196         } else if (b->a_type == A_FLOAT) {
00197             if (a->a_w.w_float > b->a_w.w_float)
00198                 return 1;
00199             else if (a->a_w.w_float == b->a_w.w_float)
00200                 return 0;
00201             else
00202                 return -1;
00203         } else {
00204             if (a->a_w.w_float > 0.)
00205                 return 1;
00206             else if (a->a_w.w_float == 0.)
00207                 return 0;
00208             else
00209                 return -1;
00210         }
00211     }
00212     return -1;
00213     // uh, yeah, I guess. return -1 when in doubt. makes as much sense as anything else.
00214     // if someone's trying to compare a t_symbol you just say it's less than whatever you're comparing it with.
00215     // in theory this should never happen with the past object.
00216 }
